skill.name: config-auditing
skill.description: Neovim configuration audit knowledge base. Use when: reviewing config files for issues, checking deprecated APIs, optimizing settings, or performing health checks. Provides checklists, best practices, and version-specific deprecated API detection patterns.
skill.summary: Neovim configuration auditing knowledge base with checklists, best practices, and deprecated API detection patterns.
skill.author: BitYoungjae

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with bash command examples for auditing Neovim configurations. The static analyzer misidentified markdown code fences (backticks) as executable code, and standard Neovim config paths (~/.config/nvim) as hidden file access. No actual code execution or malicious patterns exist.

content.value_statement: Neovim configurations often accumulate deprecated APIs, performance issues, and security vulnerabilities over time. This skill provides systematic checklists, detection patterns, and best practices for auditing and improving Neovim configurations with actionable recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Perform systematic configuration audits across structure, performance, and security categories
Detect deprecated APIs specific to Neovim versions using grep patterns
Identify performance issues like synchronous plugin loading and slow startup time
Check for security concerns including exposed credentials and insecure shell commands
Evaluate configuration against lazy.nvim and other plugin manager best practices
Generate audit reports with grades and actionable fix recommendations
limitations: This skill provides guidance and detection patterns but does not modify configurations directly
Audit commands run against user configurations require user permission and confirmation
Detection patterns may require adjustment for highly customized or unusual config structures
Does not provide plugin-specific deep-dive analysis beyond general compatibility checks

use_cases.title: New Neovim Setup Review
use_cases.description: When a user shares their Neovim configuration files, run a comprehensive audit to identify deprecated APIs, performance bottlenecks, and security issues before they cause problems.

use_cases.title: Version Migration Assistance
use_cases.description: When upgrading Neovim versions, use version-specific deprecated API checklists to identify breaking changes and provide migration paths for removed APIs.

use_cases.title: Performance Optimization
use_cases.description: Analyze startup time, lazy loading effectiveness, and autocmd patterns to suggest optimizations that improve editor responsiveness and reduce boot time.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Configuration Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit my Neovim configuration for issues. Use the config-auditing skill to check for deprecated APIs, performance problems, and security concerns. Run appropriate detection commands against ~/.config/nvim and provide a report with severity levels and fix recommendations.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants a general health check of their Neovim setup

prompt_templates.title: Version Compatibility Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my Neovim configuration for APIs that are deprecated or removed in version [VERSION]. Reference the deprecated-apis.md patterns. List each finding with file:line location and provide migration suggestions.
prompt_templates.scenario: User is upgrading Neovim and needs compatibility validation

prompt_templates.title: Performance Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my Neovim configuration for performance issues using the audit-checklist.md performance section. Check startup time, lazy loading, autocmd patterns, and plugin loading. Provide specific file:line references and optimization suggestions.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to improve Neovim startup and runtime performance

prompt_templates.title: Security Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security audit of my Neovim configuration. Check for exposed credentials (API keys, tokens), insecure shell commands, and other security concerns. Use the security checklist from audit-checklist.md and provide fix instructions.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to verify their config is secure before sharing or deployment

output_examples.input: Audit my Neovim configuration for issues
output: Plugin 'plugin-name' loads at startup without lazy event

output_examples.input: Check for deprecated APIs in Neovim 0.9
output: Status: Deprecated (still works, will be removed)

best_practices: Use lazy.nvim with appropriate loading triggers (event, cmd, ft, keys) to minimize startup plugins and improve boot time
Store credentials and secrets in environment variables via `vim.env.VARIABLE_NAME` rather than hardcoding in config files
Replace deprecated APIs like `nvim_buf_set_option` with their modern equivalents (`vim.bo[].option`) before upgrading Neovim versions
anti_patterns: Hardcoding absolute paths like `/home/user/.config/nvim` instead of using `vim.fn.stdpath('config')`
Loading all plugins at startup without lazy loading triggers, causing slow startup times
Using deprecated buffer/window option APIs that will break in future Neovim versions

faq.question: What Neovim versions does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports Neovim 0.8 through 0.10 and later. Deprecated API patterns are version-specific and are checked against the detected Neovim version during audit.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my configuration files?
faq.answer: No, this skill is read-only. It analyzes your configuration and provides recommendations. All fixes must be applied manually by the user.

faq.question: How does the audit grading system work?
faq.answer: Configurations receive grades A through F based on the count and severity of issues found. A grade A requires 0 critical and 0-2 warnings. Grades decrease as critical issues and warnings increase.

faq.question: Can I audit a Neovim config from a different machine?
faq.answer: Yes, provide the config path and Neovim version. The skill will generate detection commands you can run on the target machine or adapt for remote auditing.

faq.question: What permission does the skill need to run audits?
faq.answer: Read access to the Neovim configuration directory is required. The skill provides bash commands that you run yourself with appropriate permissions for your system.

faq.question: How do I interpret the detection patterns?
faq.answer: The skill provides grep and bash patterns targeting specific issues. These are example commands that check for common problems. Results with 'FOUND' indicate potential issues requiring review.
